title: I took $10,000 out of my 401k to help my daughter . I am very much in debt and can barely make my mortgage / living expenses.
question: Can I claim chapter 7 to get rid of my credit card debt? Do I have to wait since I gave her the money?
question_tags: Bankruptcy,Chapter 7 bankruptcy,Chapter 7 bankruptcy means test,Bankruptcy trustee,Credit,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt
answers:
Generally speaking, if you qaulify, yes you can file Chapter 7 Bankruptcy which will, in most cases, eliminate or discharge credit card debt. Unfortunately, it is not very clear as what you mean by "do I have to wait since I gave her the money?' You will need to clarify that statement before an opinion can be rendered.

You should call an attorney in your area to discuss your bankruptcy questions and to obtain specific legal advice.

The Danville Law Group provides financial advice and bankruptcy services to individuals and small business throughout Northern California.

Your situation raises two issues. First, depending on whether you took a 401k loan or a 401k withdrawal, the $10,000 may be counted as income and affect whether you pass the means test or not. The second issue is the gift to your daughter could possibly be recoverable by any bankruptcy trustee.

You need to seek local bankruptcy counsel for some advice. Your ability to file or need to wait is something an attorney can help you understand.
